body_html:
@tiger2017 when you do dd == cc, you have the exact same python object with a different name (so dd is cc returns True.
And Python numbers are immutable, so that's why you might see that it doesn't change with numbers. Try it with numpy arrays and you'll see that it behaves the same as in PyTorch.
body_text:
@tiger2017 when you do dd == cc, you have the exact same python object with a different name (so dd is cc returns True.
And Python numbers are immutable, so that's why you might see that it doesn't change with numbers. Try it with numpy arrays and you'll see that it behaves the same as in PyTorch.
body:
@tiger2017 when you do `dd == cc`, you have the exact same python object with a different name (so `dd is cc` returns `True`.
And Python numbers are immutable, so that's why you might see that it doesn't change with numbers. Try it with numpy arrays and you'll see that it behaves the same as in PyTorch.
